learningContent.title: The learningContent and learningAssessment topic types

lcInstruction.p: The <learningContent> topic contains the actual learning content. In fact, the source file for what you are reading now is a <learningContent> topic!
A <learningContent> topic can contain task, concept, and reference topics—and therefore enables you to reuse such topics in your lessons.

Use <learningAssessment> topics to create interactions to test a student’s progress after a lesson. You can also use the <learningAssessment> topics to create preassessment interactions before a lesson.
There are several interaction types, including:

ul.li: Ordering exercise (for example, placing DITA elements in their correct hierarchical order)

lcInstruction.p: Because the majority of the training content developed in DITA is based on <learningContent> and <learningAssessment> topics, later lessons in this course cover those topic types in detail.
